thumblinks: ['2017-05-30-i-used-the-one-roll-generator_tb.png']
---

I used the One-roll Generator from the next installment of Session Zero to design a small chunk of forest. Then I used Inkarnate (<a href="http://www.inkarnate.com" class="ot-anchor">www.inkarnate.com</a>) to draw a map of it (the colors are off because of my printer, those are supposed to be browns, not reds LOL)


Attachment:

<a href='https://plus.google.com/photos/101824580455031797035/albums/6425951545817328721/6425951544516697186?sqi=100084733231320276299&sqsi=495ab0e7-7352-40c7-9718-677d19c9273e'>I used the One-roll Generator from the next installment of Session Zero to design a small chunk of forest. Then I used Inkarnate (www.inkarnate.com) to draw a map of it (the colors are off because of my printer, those are supposed to be browns, not reds LOL)</a>


Map4.jpg
<div id='comment z13fc3m4zpjixb22m23wt3v5dvmdvvpij04'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/101824580455031797035_photo.jpg'> Brian Holland</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-30 15:51:01 (edited: 2017-05-30 19:31:48)</cite></p>
        <p>I meant to include this in the original post...<br /><br />The <i>position</i> of the dice tells me that it&#39;s nighttime with a <del>full</del> new moon, it&#39;s cloudy (which doesn&#39;t really matter if there&#39;s no light, but it may change to rain later), there are several Giants (I put 1 dead, 1 sleeping, and 1 fighting some Cultist&#39;s of the Dark Lord in the nodes) and an enormous Crippling Crape (which killed that dead Giant BTW!!).<br /><br />The results of the dice tell me that someone was sent to the forest to rescue a Centrinel, a Bard who lives in the forest has become lost, there may be some lore about the Shroud of Secrecy (Yeah, that&#39;s totally Harry&#39;s invisibility Cloak) may be found here, and the adventure starts with the characters seeing a Centrinel in trouble (I decided it&#39;s the Centrinel that someone was here to rescue, and the Centrinel is fighting a Centaur).<br /><br />Setting in motion!</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13fc3m4zpjixb22m23wt3v5dvmdvvpij04'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/112927717624783896961_photo.jpg'> Edward Hickcox</h4>

        <p>Where can I get access to this One-Roll Generator? It sounds fantastic!</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13fc3m4zpjixb22m23wt3v5dvmdvvpij04'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/101824580455031797035_photo.jpg'> Brian Holland</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-30 18:04:07 (edited: 2017-05-30 18:04:07)</cite></p>
        <p>Thanks <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/112927717624783896961" oid="112927717624783896961">Edward Hickcox</a></span>. It&#39;s in the third issue of my zine Session Zero. Issue 3 takes inspiration from the Harry Potter universe. You can pick it up on Patreon for a $2 or $4 pledge, or you can wait until I upload it to DriveThru RPG on June 12th and get it for $2.99<br /><br /><a href="https://www.patreon.com/user?u=5996619" data-embed="CIcDCNACCM8CCAASJmh0dHBzOi8vd3d3LnBhdHJlb24uY29tL3VzZXI_dT01OTk2NjE5On8I2aCR1MUrEiZodHRwczovL3d3dy5wYXRyZW9uLmNvbS91c2VyP3U9NTk5NjYxORomaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cucGF0cmVvbi5jb20vdXNlcj91PTU5OTY2MTkiJmh0dHBzOi8vd3d3LnBhdHJlb24uY29tL3VzZXI_" data-attachment-render-hint="1" class="ot-anchor">https://www.patreon.com/user?u=5996619</a></p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13fc3m4zpjixb22m23wt3v5dvmdvvpij04'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/101824580455031797035_photo.jpg'> Brian Holland</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-30 18:55:04 (edited: 2017-05-30 18:55:04)</cite></p>
        <p>I&#39;m working on using the same method for underground structures as well for a future issue. Here&#39;s an &quot;underground complex&quot; that I made using the exact same &quot;nodes&quot; I used in the forest map above, and I also drew a &quot;cave&quot;, &quot;mine&quot; and &quot;tomb&quot; using the nodes as well.<br /><br />The tables for underground structures will differ quite a bit though because time of day and weather don&#39;t matter under the earth!<br /><i><a href="https://plus.google.com/legacy_photo_redirect" data-embed="_" data-attachment-render-hint="2" class="ot-anchor">https://plus.google.com/photos/...</a></i></p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13fc3m4zpjixb22m23wt3v5dvmdvvpij04'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/109791996665503926061_photo.jpg'> Robert Rendell</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-30 22:25:56 (edited: 2017-05-30 22:25:56)</cite></p>
        <p><span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/101824580455031797035" oid="101824580455031797035">Brian Holland</a></span> does the position of the dice also indicate the layout of the nodes of your map WRT one another?<br /></p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13fc3m4zpjixb22m23wt3v5dvmdvvpij04'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/101824580455031797035_photo.jpg'> Brian Holland</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-30 23:03:55 (edited: 2017-05-30 23:03:55)</cite></p>
        <p><span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/109791996665503926061" oid="109791996665503926061">Robert Rendell</a></span>, the location of each die is a node (write the die type and result next to the die, the circle and remove the die).<br /><br />There are 4 aspects governed by the die closest to each cardinal position (North, East, South, West).<br /><br />You can&#39;t see it in the picture, but the &quot;North-most&quot; die is a d12, the d6 is both &quot;East&quot; and &quot;South&quot;, and the most &quot;westward&quot; die is d8.<br /><br />In my tables (which I&#39;m going to constantly customize) North = Time of day, East = Weather, South = Forest Aspect 1, West = Forest Aspect 2.<br /><br />North d12 = Nighttime with new moon<br />East d6 = cloudy<br />South d6 = several giants<br />West d8 = an enormous Crippling (it&#39;s a vicious Crape Myrtle lol)<br /><br />THEN, quite separate from that, each die with its result modifies and customizes the questions you ask your players to determine why the characters are there, and their immediate peril<br /></p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13fc3m4zpjixb22m23wt3v5dvmdvvpij04'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/101824580455031797035_photo.jpg'> Brian Holland</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-05-30 23:30:32 (edited: 2017-05-30 23:30:32)</cite></p>
        <p>...and <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/109791996665503926061" oid="109791996665503926061">Robert Rendell</a></span>, if you were asking about the paths between the nodes, then no. The dice don&#39;t tell you how to connect the nodes. That&#39;s intentional because rotating the page might make you consider different paths AND the dice at the cardinal positions will be different (shifted around the border)!</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13fc3m4zpjixb22m23wt3v5dvmdvvpij04'>

</div>
